profileText: A Representative from New York; born in Claverack, Columbia County, N.Y., February 22, 1782; attended the public schools; studied law; was admitted to the bar and practiced; surrogate of Schoharie County 1811-1813, and again from 1815 to 1822; elected as Federalist to the Seventeenth Congress (March 4, 1821-March 3, 1823); resumed the practice of law; died in Schoharie, N.Y., January 3, 1854; interment in St. Paul's Lutheran Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1853, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from John Gebhard to J. Romeyn Beck written on July 29, 1853. In the letter, John Gebhard writes regarding 23 plates (illustrations) included in the third volume of James Hall's Paleontology of New York. An illustration of the building that housed the New York State Geological Rooms is on the stationary.
